dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 729 IH: Teleabortion Prevention Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Harris of North Carolina (for himself, Mr. Clyde, Mr. Aderholt, Mr. Webster of Florida, Mr. Gill of Texas, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Cloud, Ms. Hageman, Mr. Davidson, and Mr. Onder) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit chemical abortions performed without the presence of a healthcare provider, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Teleabortion Prevention Act of 2025.

section.header: Chemical abortions prohibited without a healthcare provider present

subsection.header: Chemical abortions prohibited without a physician present
subsection.text: Chapter 74 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the chapter heading by striking Partial-Birth; and
by inserting after section 1531 the following:

section.header: Chemical abortions prohibited without a healthcare provider physically present

subsection.text: Any healthcare provider who, in or affecting interstate or foreign commerce, who knowingly provides or attempts to provide a chemical abortion—

paragraph.text: without being physically present at the location of the chemical abortion; and
without scheduling a follow-up visit for the patient to occur not more than 14 days after the administration or use of the drug to assess the patient’s physical condition,

subsection.continuation-text: shall be fined not more than $1,000 or imprisoned not more than 2 years, or both. This subsection does not apply to a chemical abortion that is necessary to save the life of a mother whose life is endangered by a physical disorder, physical illness, or physical injury, including a life-endangering physical condition caused by or arising from the pregnancy itself.

subsection.text: A patient upon whom an abortion is performed may not be prosecuted under this section or for a conspiracy to violate this section.

paragraph.text: The term abortion drug means any medicine, drug or any other substance, or any combination of drugs, medicines or substances, when it is used—

subparagraph.text: to intentionally kill the unborn child of a woman known to be pregnant; or
to intentionally terminate the pregnancy of a woman known to be pregnant, with an intention other than—

clause.text: to produce a live birth; or
to remove a dead unborn child.

paragraph.text: In this section, the term attempts to provide, means conduct that, under the circumstances as the actor believes them to be, constitutes a substantial step in a course of conduct planned to culminate in a chemical abortion.
The term healthcare provider means any person licensed to prescribe prescription drugs under applicable Federal and State laws.
In this section, the term provide, means to dispense or prescribe an abortion drug, or to otherwise make an abortion drug available to a patient.
The term chemical abortion refers to the use of an abortion drug to—

subparagraph.text: intentionally kill the unborn child of a woman known to be pregnant; or
intentionally terminate the pregnancy of a woman known to be pregnant, with an intention other than—

clause.text: to produce a live birth; or
to remove a dead unborn child.

paragraph.text: The term unborn child means an individual organism of the species homo sapiens, beginning at fertilization, until the point of being born alive as defined in section 8(b).

subsection.header: Rule of construction regarding ectopic pregnancy
subsection.text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to have any impact on the treatment of a verified ectopic pregnancy.

If any provision of this section or the application of such provision to any person or circumstance is held to be invalid, the remainder of this section and the application of the provisions of the remainder to any person or circumstance shall not be affected thereby.

paragraph.text: The table of sections for such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 1531 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1532. Chemical abortions prohibited without a healthcare provider physically present.

paragraph.text: The table of chapters for part I of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to chapter 74, and inserting the following:
